metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7102 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
ownCloud Desktop before 2.2.3 allows local users to execute arbitrary code and possibly gain privileges via a Trojan library in a "special path" in the C: drive.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7102` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

caja-owncloud - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
dolphin-owncloud - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
libowncloudsync0 - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
nautilus-owncloud - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
nemo-owncloud - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
owncloud-client - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
owncloud-client-cmd - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
owncloud-client-data - 2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> May be specific to Windows

criterions.comment: owncloud-client package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.4+dfsg-2ubuntu2').
